title: Corporate Governance Act, 2023
full_text: This Act aims to enhance corporate governance standards by mandating independent directorships, requiring robust internal control frameworks, and establishing new disclosure requirements for public companies. It also introduces stricter penalties for breaches of fiduciary duty and extends auditor responsibilities. The primary goal is to protect shareholder interests and promote transparency within corporate structures. Specific provisions include a minimum of 30% independent directors on all boards and quarterly reporting on ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) metrics. Enforcement is handled by the National Corporate Regulatory Authority.

title: Small Business Tax Relief Bill, 2024
full_text: The Small Business Tax Relief Bill of 2024 introduces several incentives for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). Key provisions include a temporary reduction in corporate income tax for businesses with less than $5 million in annual revenue from 21% to 15%, and an expanded tax credit for research and development (R&D) expenditures up to $100,000 per year. Additionally, it streamlines the process for claiming capital expense deductions and offers a one-time grant for digital transformation initiatives. This bill is designed to stimulate economic growth and support job creation within the SME sector. Eligibility for tax reduction requires businesses to have been operational for at least two years.

title: Digital Privacy and Data Protection Regulation (DPDPR)
full_text: The Digital Privacy and Data Protection Regulation (DPDPR) establishes a comprehensive framework for personal data protection. It grants individuals extensive rights over their data, including the right to access, rectification, erasure ('right to be forgotten'), and data portability. Organizations processing personal data are required to implement robust security measures, conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs), and appoint a Data Protection Officer (DPO) in certain cases. Non-compliance can result in significant fines. The regulation applies to any entity processing data of citizens, regardless of the entity's location. Consent for data processing must be explicit and verifiable.

title: Environmental Protection Act, 2023 - Water Quality Amendments
full_text: These amendments to the Environmental Protection Act focus specifically on improving and safeguarding water quality across the nation. They introduce stricter limits on industrial discharge of pollutants into natural water bodies, mandate advanced wastewater treatment technologies for municipal facilities, and establish new standards for agricultural runoff management. The Act also creates a fund for restoration projects in ecologically sensitive aquatic areas and increases monitoring requirements for groundwater contamination. Companies found in violation face escalating fines and potential operational suspension. Public participation in water management planning is also emphasized.

title: Consumer Credit Protection Ordinance
full_text: The Consumer Credit Protection Ordinance aims to protect consumers from predatory lending practices and ensure fair access to credit. It caps interest rates on payday loans at 36% APR, requires lenders to clearly disclose all fees and terms in plain language, and establishes a new independent ombudsman for consumer complaints. The ordinance also prohibits certain aggressive debt collection tactics and mandates credit counseling for individuals declaring bankruptcy. Financial institutions must conduct thorough affordability assessments before extending credit. Non-bank lenders are also brought under the purview of this regulation to ensure consistent consumer protection.
